content: The Act is titled the "Military and Veterans Education Protection Act." It pertains to program participation agreements for proprietary institutions of higher education. Section 487 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions related to institutions receiving funds under the title and Federal educational assistance. Subsection (d) is also modified to reflect Non-Federal Educational assistance. Section 487 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions related to institutions receiving Federal educational assistance. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions for proprietary institutions of higher education receiving Federal educational assistance. If an institution fails to meet a requirement for two consecutive fiscal years, it will be ineligible for Federal educational assistance programs for at least two years. To regain eligibility for Federal educational assistance programs, a proprietary institution of higher education must demonstrate compliance with all requirements for a minimum of two fiscal years after becoming ineligible. Compliance includes meeting program eligibility and certification requirements. To enforce compliance with program requirements, the Secretary of Education will determine when a proprietary institution of higher education is ineligible for federal educational assistance and notify relevant administering Secretaries for enforcement. The Secretary of Education will notify relevant administering Secretaries of a proprietary institution of higher education's ineligibility for federal educational assistance. The Secretary of Education will notify administering Secretaries if a proprietary institution of higher education receiving federal funds becomes ineligible for educational assistance programs.
